meta.name: description
meta.content: Haworth Schools is a quality pre-K through twelfth grade school system nestled in a setting of beautiful trees and grassy open fields. We are dedicated to offering our students quality education in a safe learning environment, which includes new and recently improved facilities along with state of the art technologies, arts programs, and leadership/citizenship opportunities.

span.span: Haworth Schools is a quality pre-K through twelfth grade school system nestled in a setting of beautiful trees and grassy, open fields. Our supportive community and dedicated staff continue to make major physical and technological improvements to our buildings and classrooms, which proves our dedication to give students what they deserve. Experienced teachers and community pride are the perfect combination to provide the nurturing educational experience we offer with our small school family. We feel the more you know about our schools, the more impressed you will be.

Haworth Seniors, Parents & Community,
Due to the current COVID-19 situation we will be adjusting our normal high school graduation ceremony. We will be having a graduation on the regularly scheduled date of May 16. However, we are looking at the best time-frame and will inform you of that information in the near future.
The graduation will take place outside on the north side of the auditorium on the steps. Parking arrangements for those attending will be made and specific safety guidelines will be put in place for all participating and attending. The ceremony will be like our traditional ceremony; however, we will be observing CDC and State Department guidelines and have less than 10 people out of vehicles at a time.
The graduates will still be able to give their prepared speeches and “walk the stage” to receive their diplomas. The graduates will be in their vehicles along the front rows and will exit their vehicle and come to the stage one at a time. Parents and guests will be in the parking lot inside their vehicles, parked facing the stage, watching the ceremony. We will have an official photographer taking pictures and they will be available to seniors ASAP as a print out and digital form for their use. The ceremony will be broadcasted live on KBEL 96.7 and also streamed live on our school’s Facebook Page.
We know this is not an ideal situation; however, we are dealing with unprecedented times and providing our seniors with a safe and unique ceremony to recognize them for their years of hard work. More information will be provided soon as we work through this situation. Thank you for your patience.
Go Lions!

div.class: custom_58177 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

div.span: Please complete the attached survey. Only one survey per household should be filled out. The information from this survey will be used to best serve our students throughout the rest of the semester. Information from this survey will remain private and for school use only. If you know of anyone needing help with this survey please reach out to them and help during this time.
Click on link below to open survey. Thank you.

span.span: The State Board of Education met March 25
in Oklahoma City and determined that all schools will be out for the remainder of this school year. This also includes all extra-curricular activities.

Currently, our meal program will continue in to the first weeks of May. A specific cut off date will be provided at a later time. Even though school is out, there will be distance learning required for us to participate. This will begin Monday, April 6

Our staff will begin the process of putting this area together. We will provide you further details of how this will work as quickly as possible. Once again, we don’t have all of the answers but as soon as we learn more we will inform you. It is one step at a time.
Continue to be safe and work together. We will provide further information concerning upcoming academic requirements and other areas as the overall plan is organized.
Haworth Public Schools will be providing free breakfast/lunch bags
The meals are for individuals in the school district
These meals can be picked up at three (3) locations:
We will continue to provide this service as long as needed.

p.span: The following resources are for students, teachers, and parents. These links are reference sites made available from our faculty as well as some in our community who are committed to assisting students and parents as much as possible, not only during this time of distance learning, but also throughout many of our educational proccesses. Throughout the next few days, more will be added as more are received by the Website Manager. Thank you for your support and happy learning!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

ul.li: https://www.getepic.com/ EPIC Books is a digital library for kids to access at home and at school. Currently, Haworth Schools Reading Specialist Patty Burns is working on a school to home program that will be free to students through June 30. She will be sending home information as soon as classroom teachers collect parent emails for her to share information. Most students are already familiar with this program.

When you create the lesson, there is a one-click option to immediately assign in gClassroom.

ul.li: https://stories.audible.com Audible, an Amazon Company. While schools are closed, kids everywhere can instantly stream a collection of stories. All stories are free to stream on desktop, laptop, phone, or tablet.
ReadWorks is an online resource of reading passages and lesson plans for students of all levels K-12. https://www.readworks.org/

https://childmind.org Many parents are wondering how to bring up the COVID 19 epidemic in a way that will be reassuring and not make kids more worried than they already may be. Here is some advice from the experts at the Child Mind Institute.
http://www.oeta.tv/education/resources/ Learning at Home – OETA is collaborating with the Oklahoma State Department of Education (OSDE) to provide in-home learning opportunities for students.
Elem Math games, logic puzzles and educational resources https://www.mathplayground.com/
Free printables library with activities for children 0-6 https://www.littlesparkcompany.com/printables-library
Movement and mindfulness videos created by child development experts. https://www.gonoodle.com/

li.span: NoRedInk builds stronger writers through interest-based curriculum, adaptive exercises, and actionable data. Haworth Schools is using this program and currently NoRedInk is free through the rest of this school year. Hundreds of free writing and grammar exercises for grades 5-12.

ul.li: https://www.vocesdigital.com Digital Curriculum Resources for Spanish, French, and ESL.Voces is a collection of world language titles covering Spanish levels 1-AP®, French levels 1-3, and ESL levels 1-4, and incorporating grammar, vocabulary, and comprehensible input-based approaches to language learning. (Currently, this program is offering a free trial for use during distance learning.)

div.strong: Free Accounts and Free Educational Resources

ul.li: List of companies offering free accounts for school closures - This list from AmazingEducationalResources.com is overwhelmingly comprehensive!
Good Housekeeping's List of Free Accounts - The companies listed in this article are offering free accounts, and you don't necessarily have to be a parent or teacher to get them.
Milwaukee With Kids has compiled this Google Sheet to collect resources, sorted by content area.Someone on FB shared this list of Virtual Field Trips.

div.span: Two Important Notes about using video with your students:

div.div: 1 - It's important for your students to see YOU. We all know that one of the most important factors in teaching/learning is that of RELATIONSHIPS - and your students need that connection even more when we're dealing with distance education.

2 - If making a video lesson, commit yourself to doing it in ONE TAKE - and just deal with noises, people interrupting, & mistakes as you would if you were teaching live. This is important for 3 reasons: it allows you to stay "in the flow" of your lesson, it allows you to limit the time you spend making the video, and (most importantly!) it allows you to LET GO OF THE CONCEPT OF "PERFECT"!

ul.li: Screencastify Chrome Extension allows you to record from webcam or screen, or both
Screencast-o-matic.com - free online screen recorder
Zoom - video conference program
Zoom Tutorial - from Howfinity on YouTube
Google Meet - video conference app, already enabled for teachers (go to the Google App "waffle" or to meet.google.com).
Do you need a document camera for your video conference lesson? Combine your desktop computer with cell phone!

div.p: Are you taking the ACT test this fall? Take a free practice test to get familiar with the type of questions you'll be asked on the exam! https://bit.ly/2Ls29ne

img.alt: Jostens icon for announcements about senior items and class rings

div.p: Jostens will deliver caps and gowns by the end of this semester. We are waiting for more information regarding how long school buidings will be closed to set a date for delivery. Class rings and senior items will be mailed to your homes. Please contact Josten’s or Mrs. A. Smith if you do not receive all of your items/rings by the end of April. We still have a few students with outstanding balances for senior items, including caps and gowns. Please make sure that all balances are paid asap. to ensure that they can be received. Please make sure you have ordered your cap/gown units. Our school will have more information regarding graduation ceremony when available.

div.h3: Haworth Schools Mission and Vision Statements

p.span: The mission of Haworth Schools is to provide each student a diverse education in a safe, supportive environment that promotes high moral character, self-discipline, motivation, and excellence in learning.

The vision of Haworth Schools is to provide opportunities for students, faculty, staff, parents and community to develop through communication, a sense of ownership, spirit, and pride in the school. Not only must students be prepared academically, but also be nurtured with a sense of cultural awareness which includes an appreciation of tolerance, diversity, community, and the arts.
